definitions.definition: To come apart into long sharp fragments .
examples: The tall tree splintered during the storm.

definitions.definition: To cause to break apart into long sharp fragments.
examples: His third kick splintered the door.

definitions.definition: To break, or cause to break, into factions .
examples: The government splintered when the coalition members could not agree.
The unpopular new policies splintered the company.

definitions.definition: To fasten or confine with splinters, or splints, as a broken limb.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To come apart into long sharp fragments .
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To cause to break apart into long sharp fragments.
( figuratively , of a group ) To break, or cause to break, into factions .
( transitive ) To fasten or confine with splinters, or splints, as a broken limb.
